course.name: Done is better - Build What Matters

questions.question: A client expects a delivery date you are not sure you can meet. What should you do?
options: Share the constraint or trade-off you have not mentioned; propose how you will handle it together

questions.question: In this framework, how is "from client to partner" defined?
options: Share constraints, timelines, and trade-offs; invite them into the problem, not just the deliverable
Give the client everything they ask for without pushback
Treat the client as the enemy to manage
Only share deliverables and hide constraints

questions.question: How do you build trust through transparency with a client?
options: Share one constraint or trade-off you have not mentioned; propose how you will handle it together

questions.question: Hiding problems to preserve the relationship short-term can lead to:
options: Surprises later and broken trust when the problem surfaces

questions.question: Treating the client as someone to please rather than to align with tends to:
options: Overpromising and underdelivering; no real partnership

questions.question: What should you share with a client or partner?
options: Constraints, timelines, trade-offs, and unknowns so they can align

questions.question: What is the next step with one client or partner?
options: Share one constraint or trade-off you have not mentioned before; propose how you will handle it together
